channel.title: Species interactions on Biodiversity Dynamics | Sebastian Block
channel.description: Recent content in Species interactions on Biodiversity Dynamics | Sebastian Block

item.title: Competitor Adaptation and Climate Change Responses
item.description: Adaptation to competitors can promote or difficult persistence in novel environments depending on the alignment between selective pressures imposed by competitors and by the changing environment. The fine scale mosaic of selective pressures created by contrasting competitive neighbourhoods can cause patterns of local adaptation that increase the resilience of metapopulations facing climate change.

item.title: Species Interactions in Warmer Alps
item.description: Novel competitors can shape plant community responses to climate change, but the timescales of their effects are poorly understood. During my PhD, I will integrate field experiments with mechanistic models to explore the relative timescales of community dynamics driven by novel competitors and by changing interactions among current competitors. I will also explore the usefulness of functional traits as predictors of species responses to changing climates and competitive environments.
